column1: word,,define,pronounce,sentence,speech,capital
Credential,,證書,/krɪˈdɛnʃəl/,"She received a credential from the university.",n.,Credential
Hiring committee,,雇用委員會,/ˈhaɪrɪŋ kəˈmɪti/,"The hiring committee will review all applications.",phr.,Hiring Committee
On...occasion,,偶爾,/ɒn ... əˈkeɪʒən/,"On rare occasions, he visits his hometown.",phr.,On...Occasion
Overqualified,,條件太好的,/ˌoʊvɚˈkwɑːlɪfaɪd/,"She was rejected for being overqualified for the job.",adj.,Overqualified
Screening,,篩檢；審查,/ˈskriːnɪŋ/,"The screening process takes about two weeks.",n.,Screening
Oriented,,以...為方向的;以...為目的的,/ˈɔːrɪɛntɪd/,"He is goal-oriented in his career.",adj.,Oriented
Pertaining to,,與...有關,/pɚˈteɪnɪŋ tu/,"The rules pertaining to safety must be followed.",phr.,Pertaining To
Questionably,,可疑地,/ˈkwɛsʧənəbli/,"He acted questionably during the meeting.",adv.,Questionably
Replenish,,補充，再裝滿,/rɪˈplɛnɪʃ/,"She replenished the water bottles before the trip.",v.,Replenish
Stellar,,主要的 顯著的 星形的,/ˈstɛlɚ/,"She gave a stellar performance in the play.",adj.,Stellar
Versatile,,多才多藝的；多用途的,/ˈvɝːsətɪl/,"He is a versatile musician.",adj.,Versatile
Adept,,熟練的、內行的,/əˈdɛpt/,"She is adept at solving complex problems.",adj.,Adept
Adopt,,採納、收養,/əˈdɑːpt/,"They decided to adopt a child.",v.,Adopt
Adapt,,使適應、改編,/əˈdæpt/,"He quickly adapted to the new environment.",v.,Adapt
Commensurate,,同樣大小的、相稱的,/kəˈmɛnsərɪt/,"Salary will be commensurate with experience.",adj.,Commensurate
Computer literate,,懂得使用電腦的,/kəmˈpjuːtɚ ˈlɪtərɪt/,"All employees must be computer literate.",adj.,Computer Literate
Eagerness,,熱心,/ˈiːɡɚnəs/,"His eagerness to learn impressed his teacher.",n.,Eagerness
Interpersonal skills,,人際關係能力,/ˌɪntɚˈpɝːsənəl skɪlz/,"Good interpersonal skills are essential for this role.",phr.,Interpersonal Skills
Preeminent,,卓越的、顯著的,/priˈɛmɪnənt/,"She is a preeminent scientist in her field.",adj.,Preeminent
Preliminary,,預備的、初步的,/prɪˈlɪmɪnɛri/,"The preliminary results look promising.",adj.,Preliminary
Prerequisite,,必要的,/priˈrɛkwəzɪt/,"Basic math is a prerequisite for this course.",adj.,Prerequisite
Prerequisite,,必要條件,/priˈrɛkwəzɪt/,"A degree is a prerequisite for this job.",n.,Prerequisite
Probationer,,試用人員,/proʊˈbeɪʃənɚ/,"The probationer will be evaluated after three months.",n.,Probationer
Sternly,,嚴格地,/ˈstɝːnli/,"The teacher spoke sternly to the misbehaving students.",adv.,Sternly
